audio_descriptions.notes:
This is an audio description of the Pixar SparkShort, “Kitbull”. The film is traditionally animated, meaning hand drawn. While the backgrounds, like a city street or a yard, look more realistic, the animals in the film are cute and cartoonistic. 

Cars pass on busy street. 
A cute black kitten runs skittishly, hiding behind signs on a bustling city sidewalk with a fish in his mouth.
A woman sweeping a storefront kneels to the cat. He runs away from her under a car, and then down a dark alley, passing a fence painted with graffiti.
The kitten sneaks through a crack in the fence into a grassy yard, and climbs atop a neighboring fence, where he stares warily as pigeons perch on a wood pile below.
He jumps from the fence and scares the birds away.
The cat takes the fish in his mouth and crawls into a cardboard box atop the pile, Inside, he snuggles against a purple stuffed elephant and puts down his fish.
The cat licks his paw, scratches his ear, and settles onto a pillow inside the box. 
Night time.
Headlights illuminate the yard as a car approaches.
The kitten stretches, and awakes, alarmed, with one eye wide open. 
The cat hides under the elephant. 
The cat looks out from its box as two men set a wooden crate in the yard, while another guides a dog on a chain.
The cat hides.
Day time. 
The cat peeks out from the box and looks around.
The wooden crate is empty.
The dog is standing right by the box, drooling. 
The cat claws at the dog’s large nose and misses.
The dog runs away and stares curiously at the cat.
He approaches cautiously, but the cat lashes out, his back arched and claws out.
The cat runs in place with its eyes lowered and its hair standing up. 
The dog jumps playfully, wagging his tail. He lowers his body to the ground. 
A man’s foot steps onto the porch. The dog turns toward him and the cat runs back to the box.
The dog wags his tail, as the man puts a collar on the dog’s neck, turns and kneels beside the crate. 
Wagging his tail, the dog follows the man, as he goes back upstairs and closes the door.  
The dog sits at the bottom of the steps with his head lowered. 
He turns to the cat, who retreats into the box. 
The dog lays alone beside the crate in the empty yard.
The cat peeks out from the box, and begins to crawl down from the garbage pile when a plastic bottle rolls out from under him. 
The cat scurries to the box, and a bottle cap rolls on the ground below. 
He comes back out and approaches the cap with caution. 
The cat taps the cap with his paw and it rolls away. His eyes widen in amusement.
The cat chases the cap. 
He pounces, sending it rolling out of his reach. 
It hits the dog’s nose. 
The cat runs  to hide as the dog wakes.
The cat’s eyes widen as the cap returns to him. 
The cat rolls around playfully with the cap in his paws.
The dog approaches slowly. The cat stiffens and his hair rises. 
But a chain holds the dog back. 
With wide eyes, the cat looks between the cap and the dog. 
The cap rolls to the barbed wire that separates them.
The cat nudges the cap with his paws, sending it back towards the dog. 
The dog lifts his head in amusement and the cat scurries away. 
Quickly, the cap rolls and hits the cat. The cat jumps, falls back to play with the cap, and jumps again. He leaps toward the cap, plays dead, and nudges the cap again. 
Wagging his tail, the dog returns it. 
An airplane soars in clouds above.
The cat runs back to the box. He peeks out. 
The man holds a blue stuffed bear the the dog, and holds on as the dog tears it away with his teeth.
The dog rips off its head. He sits and wags his tail as the man pats his head and goes upstairs.

Through a hole in the cardboard, the cat’s eyes widen as he retreats to hide near the elephant.

At night, it is pouring rain.   
The man kicks the dog and send him rolling down the stairs. Many bloody cuts cover the dog’s body. 
He lays on the floor in the rain. 
He limps up the stairs. The cat watches from the box, as the dog scratches the door.
The cat huddles beside the elephant, then jumps up as items fall through the cardboard roof, releasing rain into the box. A piece of wood hits the box, and it hurdles down the pile. 
The cat leaps in fear, as his head is caught in plastic soda rings. The rings are stuck on the barbed wire. 
The dog approaches. The cat struggles to run away. 
The dog moves the wire with his teeth. He bites the plastic rings, letting the cat free.
The cat scratches the dog’s nose. The dog backs away with sad eyes. 
Lightning flashes over the cat’s crouched body as his eyes widen and he runs up the pile. 
The cat watches as the dog lowers his head, and limps slowly into his crate.
The cat lays on a wood beam in the pile as his wide eyes stare at the dog’s crate.
Early morning. The rain has stopped. 
The cat sits on a toppled garbage can. His paw dangles and he tail wags.
The cat jumps down and sits next to the cap on the ground. He taps it gently. It rolls and stops. 
The cat looks toward the dog in the crate and hits the cap again. It rolls to the crate. The dog is still. 
Staring at the still dog widely, the cat lowers his ears and approaches cautiously.
The cat’s paw reaches into the crate. He peeks at the dog, who faces the back wall. 
The cat enters the crate carefully. The dog stirs. The cat halts.
The cat turns to leave, then stops and looks back. 
Instead, he lowers his ears and lays at the dog’s side. The dog’s are opened now. 
The cat inches closer and licks the dog’s wounds. 
The dog closes his eyes. 
The cat rubs its head on the dog’s face and lays down. Both close their eyes. 
The dog wags his tail, and looks at the cat. He closes his eyes once more. 
The cat jumps down from the crate and hits the cap with its paws. 
The dog and cat jump around the cap as it moves. 
The porch light switches on. 
The dog cowers with its tail between its legs, the cat runs away. 
The cat stops to turn toward the dog.
The dog turns to follow. 
The cat runs up an angled plank of wood to the top of the fence and looks down. 
The dog struggles to follow as the wood breaks. 
The wood pile begins to fall beneath the dog. 
The cat runs back down and hurries the dog to move with its paws. The cat jumps on the dog’s head. The dog jumps. His front legs reach the top of the fence. His back legs dangle, but he pulls himself up and over the fence.
Chain in hand, the man walks downstairs to an empty backyard and looks around. 

Day time. A bus drives down a busy street.
In an alley, the cat wags his tail, pounces playfully and bites the dog’s tail.
The pair hop around each other. The cat hops on the dog’s face and the dog rolls over on his back with his tongue out. 
The cat runs over two garbage cans. A person places an open can of food on the ground. The cat approaches slowly. 
The woman sits cross-legged and reaches her hand out toward the cat. The cat turns to leave, then turns back toward her. The cat rubs his head on her hand affectionately. She strokes the cat’s head with her thumb.
The dog appears from behind a tree with scars on his face. As he approaches, the woman stands up quickly. 
The cat parades around the dog’s front leg, rubbing his head on his leg. He sits below the dog.
The woman moves closer and kneels. She reaches out and pets the dogs head gently, as he looks back at her. 

The cat frolics through a green field. The dog follows wearing an orange bandana. 
The cat jumps on the dog’s head. Together, they sit with the woman and a man on a hilltop overlooking the city. 

On a vibrantly painted fence, a mural of the cat and dog reads the word “Kitbull.

result.title: Kitbull | Pixar SparkShorts
result.description:
Kitbull, directed by Rosana Sullivan and produced by Kathryn Hendrickson, reveals an unlikely connection that sparks between two creatures: a fiercely independent stray kitten and a pit bull. Together, they experience friendship for the first time. 

More #SparkShorts are coming to Disney+ in 2019. Sign up for updates at http://disneyplus.com 

Meet the filmmakers behind Kitbull: https://youtu.be/7Nj8tNjs074 
See how the film was made: https://youtu.be/I6AMdsH0-uo

Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/Pixar
 
Instagram: 
https://www.instagram.com/pixar/ 
 
Twitter: 
https://twitter.com/DisneyPixar
 
Copyright: (C) Disney•Pixar
